creator: ishaigorodsky@yahoo.com
text:
Dear Apachean

Apache HTTPD 2.2.17 is configured with the following reverse proxying directives

AllowEncodedSlashes On
ProxyPass /abc/def/ https://other:port/abc/def/
ProxyPassReverse /abc/def/ https://other:port/abd/def/

Requests below are successfully reverse proxied

https://myhost.mydomain.com/abc/def/page
https://myhost.mydomain.com/abc/def/page?timezone%3DAU%26params%3Dtest

while the request (URL encoded and not encoded) results in 403 Forbidden error: You don't have permission to access /abc/def/page on this server.

https://myhost.mydomain.com/abc/def/page?timezone=AU&params=<Params><Param id="ARG_start" val="'now', '-100 days'"/><Param id="ARG_stop" val="'now'"/></Params>

https://myhost.mydomain.com/abc/def/page?timezone%3DAU%26params%3D%3CParams%3E%3CParam%20id%3D%22ARG_start%22%20val%3D%22%27now%27%2C%20%27-100%20days%27%22%2F%3E%3CParam%20id%3D%22ARG_stop%22%20val%3D%22%27now%27%22%2F%3E%3C%2FParams%3E

My conclusion that the XML passed as parameters is the issue, however I was not able to locate anything that explicitly forbids such query strings or makes such query string acceptable.

Please advise
Irena

Created attachment 27995
Snippet of ssl_error_log at the time of the request
creator: ishaigorodsky@yahoo.com
ishaigorodsky@yahoo.com
text:
Thank you Eric for checking the issue
There are no errors per say in the ssl_error_log (attached). Please see additional 2 snippets relevant to the request

ssl_access_log
1.16.40.40 - - [28/Nov/2011:09:45:54 -0800] "GET /abc/def/page?timezone%3DAU%26params%3D%3CParams%3E%3CParam%20id%3D%22ARG_start%22%20val%3D%22%27now%27%2C%20%27-100%20days%27%22%2F%3E%3CParam%20id%3D%22ARG_stop%22%20val%3D%22%27now%27%22%2F%3E%3C%2FParams%3E HTTP/1.1" 403 316

ssl_request_log
[28/Nov/2011:09:45:54 -0800] <ip> TLSv1 AES128-SHA "GET /abc/def/page?timezone%3DAU%26params%3D%3CParams%3E%3CParam%20id%3D%22ARG_start%22%20val%3D%22%27now%27%2C%20%27-100%20days%27%22%2F%3E%3CParam%20id%3D%22ARG_stop%22%20val%3D%22%27now%27%22%2F%3E%3C%2FParams%3E HTTP/1.1" 316

creator: covener@gmail.com
text: Are you sure you've got nothing like mod_security? Can you share your complete configuration?

Hi Eric 
Please see httpd.conf and ssl.conf attached. There is no mod_security in either of the files: grep mod_security returns nothing in conf and conf.d directories. 
Irena
creator: ishaigorodsky@yahoo.com

text:
Hi Eric or another Apachean

It's being a while seens I saw any updates on the issue and the status is still new. I wander how the triage process works and when and how is it going to be assign to someone to look at. If there is anything on my end that I can investigate further, I would appreciate any pointers.

Thanks,
Irena
creator: ishaigorodsky@yahoo.com
covener@gmail.com
text: It doesn't get assigned to anyone.  People look at it as they get the time and interest.
Is there a way for me to debug this? Any documentation on how to launch httpd in debugger?
creator: ishaigorodsky@yahoo.com
